strings:
You have a photograph for this challenge!
Go and show it to Cameron!
Purresident of the Great Sabrecat Trust

With the camera, of course! Good Goddess,
I don't advocate violence!
As a gentle introduction to my photographic challenges, I'd like you to snap a shot of a monster out in the wild. Any one will do!
The monsters known as jailcats are said to be very pernickety pusses when it comes to hygiene. Just occasionally, you can actually spot them washing their faces. That's what I want a snap of!

I hear there's a monster called a khalamari kid that likes to draw little doodles on the ground. It's clearly rather a juvenile thing to behave like that. Apparently you see them stretching sometimes, too, and generally doing whatever they want to do. Could you snap me a shot if you see one doodling?

I don't know what they're called, but there's a type of monster that's twins, apparently. They look almost identical, but one's always red and one's always yellow, I hear. And they're totally inseparable.
Would you snap me a shot if you happen to see one?

There's a monster that looks rather like a luscious pair of lips, would you believe? A kisser, it's called. It breathes Sweet Breath and puts travellers to sleep before attempting to plant a peck on its unsuspecting victims.
Yes, it's a terrifying creature, but might you be brave enough to snap me a shot of one?

I've heard people talking about a monster
that's a knight atop a green-coloured slime.
If you come across one, would you be so
kind as to snap me a decent picture of this extraordinary<->sounding creature?

They say the monsters called tap devils are exceptional dancers. Apparently, they just start boogieing away whenever the mood takes them! Quite unbelievable, isn't it?
Well, perhaps you could take me a photograph of one dancing so I can see for myself if it's really true or not!

Somewhere in this wonderful world of ours is
a monster made entirely of gold called a gold golem, apparently. Now there's a walking fortune if I ever I heard of one!
I should very much like to see a photograph
of that if you could oblige?

I've heard mention of a monster, ominously called a killing machine, that has red eyes and a blue body. It's uncommonly violent, but its sleek appearance has gained it a dedicated fan base.
It would be madness to go anywhere near such
a thing, but if you happened to, well, go mad, perhaps you could snap me a shot of one?

I'm afraid I don't know the thing's name, but I hear there's a kind of monster that's sort of purple and blue, with a grim-looking face on its back. It's usually docile as far as I can tell, but can turn very menacing indeed if provoked.
I must say, I would love to see a photograph of this exceptional beast. Could you take one?

I've heard mention of a rather enigmatic<->sounding monster called a dark star.
How can a star be dark, I ask you?
I'm really most curious about it.
If you spot one, could you snap me a shot,
do you think?

Apparently there are giant blue lizard-like dragons somewhere in the world that are supposed to bring you good fortune. Not my experience, however! I very nearly came to a sticky end once when I encountered one myself!
Anyway, if you happen to see one of these dubiously lucky dragons, would you mind trying to sneak a photograph of it for me?

People claim there are great sabrecats as white as snow out there, you know. I don't suppose I'll ever be able to ride one myself, but if I could at least see a photograph of such a magnificent beast...
Would you be so good as to snap me a shot of one of these so-called light sabrecats?

I've heard talk of so-called sablecats <endash> jet-black sabrecats with purple manes. I don't suppose I'll ever get to ride one myself, but if I could at least see a photograph of such a magnificent beast...
Could you try to snap me a shot of one of these mysterious creatures?

Everyone loves metal slimes, don't they? For all manner of reasons. But the little nuggets are so hard to come by.
Do you think you could snap me a shot of one of these paragons of preciousness?

We'd all like to come across a liquid metal slime, of course. But those little critters are more slippery than a banana skin soaked in oil!
Do you think you could snap me a shot of one of these silver standards of scarcity?

Metal king slimes are the rulers of their class in every way, I say. The fastest to flee, the hardest to hit, the most sought-after to spot!
Do you think you could snap me a shot of one of these super-sized silvery sovereigns?

Ever since the sky turned red recently, I've been hearing a most disturbing rumour. Apparently, a monster has appeared in the sky that's larger than a mountain! I cling to the hope that it is just a tall tale, but I'd like some more concrete reassurance.
Could you take a photograph of whatever this giant thing is that people are seeing in the sky?

People say that somewhere in the world, lying dormant in slumber, is the most mighty and most dastardly of all monsters, who was sealed away in antiquity.
If you happen to chance upon such a fearsome creature, don't forget to snap a shot of it for me!

Apparently, if you defeat thirty slimes, a large monster appears in the countryside around Farebury.
It's a rather rare occurrence, so I wonder if you might snap me a shot of it? But I hear it's considerably tougher than other monsters, so mind you don't get creamed!

Apparently, if you defeat thirty mummy boys,
a very colourful monster appears to the north of the bridge in Ascantha.
It's a rather rare occurrence, so I wonder if you might snap me a shot of it? But I hear it's a lot tougher than other monsters, so don't get beaten. I don't want to have to take the ‘wrap’!

Apparently, if you defeat thirty minidemons,
a peculiarly dressed monster appears on the coast between Ascantha and Pickham.
It's a rather rare occurrence, so I wonder if
you might snap me a shot of it? But I hear
it's considerably tougher than other monsters,
so be careful ‘pitting’ yourself against it.

Apparently, if you defeat thirty terror tabbies,
a shiny, golden monster appears in the forest in Trodain.
It's a rather rare occurrence, so I wonder if
you might snap me a shot of it? But I hear
it's considerably tougher than other monsters,
so don't let it ‘cat’ you out.

Apparently, if you defeat thirty treefaces,
an unusual pink-coloured monster appears in
the Baccarat region.
It's a rather rare occurrence, so I wonder if you might snap me a shot of it? But I hear it's a lot tougher than other monsters, so don't be afraid to ‘bough’ out of battle if it gets too much.

Apparently, if you defeat thirty night sneakers, an amazingly jolly monster appears in the bleak Blizzard Peaks region.
It's a rather rare occurrence, so I wonder if
you might snap me a shot of it? But I hear
it's considerably tougher than other monsters,
so ‘yule’ have to be extra careful.

Apparently, if you defeat thirty Pandora's boxes, a devilish trickster of a monster appears on an island somewhere.
It's a rather rare occurrence, so I wonder if
you might snap me a shot of it? But I hear
it's considerably tougher than other monsters,
so it won't miss a trick in battle. Be careful!

I hear there's a stunning statue in the Tower of Alexandra crafted by the woman that gives the tower its name. She's said to be descended from the great sages, you know. Some say the statue is of the Goddess, but others believe it's an image of Alexandra herself.
Anyway, could you take a photograph of it for me? The statue, not the tower.

The first thing you think of when someone mentions Port Prospect is the great lighthouse, of course. It's such a beacon!
Perhaps you could go and capture the building in all its glory for me, do you think?

I hear the open air market at Peregrin Quay is always bustling. With the backdrop of the ships in dock, a photograph of the market would be marvellous, I think.
Could you oblige?

Apparently there's a magnificent example of stained glasswork in a building behind Maella Abbey.
Unfortunately, it's not accessible to the general public, but is there some way you could get a photograph of it for me, do you think?

There are rumours of a grim torture chamber in the depths of Maella Abbey. People talk of torture devices bristling with metal spikes!
I'm sure it's not the kind of place you'd like to find yourself, but if there's any way you could snap a shot of the place, I would be fascinated!

There's a little place called Simpleton not far from Maella Abbey, and the pub there <endash> The Cock and Bull <endash> is supposed to be full of ruffians and ne'er-do-wells.
I can't help being curious about the place. Could you photograph a typical pub scene there for me, do you think?

I've heard mention of some stained glasswork in Maella Abbey depicting a knight of some sort. It's supposed to be such a phenomenal example, pilgrims are awestruck when they see it.
If you happen to gain access to the abbey at any point, could you snap a shot of it for me? It's a circular stained-glass window, I hear.

Apparently there's a little hill somewhere in Ascantha where your every wish will be granted!
I'd love to know what's up there. Could you
take a photograph of the top of the hill for me,
do you think?

I've heard talk of a little place in Ascantha where they make the finest yarn in the land on a rickety old spinning wheel!
Could you take a photograph of this important family ‘heirloom’, do you think?

I gather Ascantha Castle has a rather unusual construction. The banners tumbling from its uppermost reaches are said to compliment the castle's form, creating a most beautiful effect.
Could you capture the full majesty of the building in a photograph that shows the great banners?

The view from the top of Ascantha Castle is said to be quite sensational.
I must see it! Please, capture it in a photograph for me.

I hear there's a strange labyrinth in the vicinity of Pickham where many statues of swordsmen can be found. Someone told me that there is a particularly impressive and large pair of them standing together inside the place somewhere.
Do you think you could snap a shot of those two magnificent statues?

Pickham is a town famous for its rogues, scoundrels and bandits, I hear. There is supposed to be a lookout post that commands a view over the whole town.
Could you find it and take a picture to show me what the place looks like, do you think?

Apparently, there's a particular place in Pickham where a secret society of suspicious individuals meet. There's some suggestion they may be called ‘The Cleaners’...
The thought of dodgy dealings underground in the already dodgy dive of Pickham is more than my curiosity can bear! I need a photograph!

There's a very intriguing rumour that somewhere not too far from Pickham is a mysterious circular building, inside of which
is some sort of secret colosseum.
Could you find out if the rumours are true,
and snap me a shot of the arena if so?

I hear a new champion of the Monster Arena has recently been crowned! And that Morrie, who runs the famous battle contest, has even erected a statue in honour of the new champ!
Could you take a photograph of the statue for me, do you think?

Rumour has it that the world-famous Castle Trodain has recently been enveloped in thorny vines. They say it happened overnight!
It seems too incredible to believe. Could you go and take a photograph of the castle for me?

I hear there is a most splendid piano inside Castle Trodain. A present from a former king
of Argonia, no less. They say the now<->missing princess used to enjoy playing it.
Do you think you might be able to take a photograph of this regal musical instrument?

Apparently there are some rather special statues of great sabrecats somewhere in the Baccarat region. Four of them altogether, I hear.
Could you snap me a shot of each of these magnificent-sounding works of art?

Apparently there are some rather special statues of great sabrecats somewhere in the Baccarat region. Four of them altogether, I hear.
Could you snap me a shot of each of these magnificent-sounding works of art?

Apparently there are some rather special statues of great sabrecats somewhere in the Baccarat region. Four of them altogether, I hear.
Could you snap me a shot of each of these magnificent-sounding works of art?

Apparently there are some rather special statues of great sabrecats somewhere in the Baccarat region. Four of them altogether, I hear.
Could you snap me a shot of each of these magnificent-sounding works of art?

I've heard intriguing rumours of a mysterious tree somewhere around Baccarat that you can only see in the early hours of the morning.
Obviously, if you come across this curious phenomenon, I should very much like to see a photograph of it!

Could you go and take me a photograph of
the church that's on the cape to the north of Baccarat?
I think that would make a sensational shot!
Everyone knows Baccarat is casino country. Could you take me a photograph of the bright neon casino sign, do you think?

I hear there's a famous act of three bunny girls who perform in the Baccarat pub. Their evening dance show is supposed to be especially popular.
If you're passing by the town on your travels, you couldn't stop in and capture the trio on film for me, could you?

Apparently, there's a statue of one of the great sages of old still surviving somewhere in Baccarat. Almost all record of the great sages has been lost now, so this is a real gem.
I should be very grateful if you could take me a photograph of the statue for posterity.

I keep hearing talk of a funny building in the vicinity of Baccarat that's modelled on a great sabrecat.
Obviously, I'd love to have a photograph of that! Could you oblige?

I hear there's a portrait on display in Argonia Castle of the young Prince Charmles by a most eminent artist.
It's supposed to be really rather a remarkable work of art. Do you think you could snap me a shot of it sometime?

As I'm sure you know, Argonia Castle is famous for both the solidity and beauty of its construction.
Could you take a photograph for me that truly captures the aesthetics and majesty of the great fortress?

Apparently, there's a secret club somewhere in Argonia that only admits adults. According to the rumours, wonderful bunny girls work there who can relieve one's weariness at the drop of a hat.
If you happen to find yourself in the place, could you take a photograph of the bunny
there for me?

Have you also heard the rumours about the people in some town or other who recently disappeared from their home in the dead of night? Apparently an eerie light appeared in
the room where it happened.
I realise it's scary, but do you think you could find the place and photograph the true nature
of this light?

I've heard tales from the desert of an under[-]ground cavern complex with a great many dragon bones inside. They say most of the
skulls within are of the two-horned variety,
but there is just one with three.
If you find the special dragon's cranium, could you snap a shot of it for me?

I've heard tales of an under[-]ground cavern complex in the desert full of dragon bones. Apparently, deep inside is a pedestal on which sits a mysterious crystal ball.
I'm told only members of a certain family from Baccarat can gain access to the place, so I'm sure I'll never be able to see it for myself. But if you could photograph it, that would be splendid!

Of course, the face of Arcadia can only be Master Dominico, the great magician himself! And his mansion there is iconic. Apparently there is a beautiful fountain and statue of the great man in its grounds.
<nbsp> 
If you visit the place, could you snap me shot of the statue, do you think?

I hear there's a wonderful pipe organ inside the church in Arcadia, with magnificent pipes set off by glorious gilt panels studded with stars.
If you happen to come across it, do take a photograph for me, won't you?

People say that somewhere inside Master Dominico's mansion is an enormous cauldron, passed down through generations of the Diakonos family. It's so large, a full-grown adult could fit inside, apparently. I can't imagine what the man uses it for!
Anyway, if you ever catch a glimpse of it, do snap a shot, won't you?

I hear there's a most unusual tower in the vicinity of Arcadia, built by a famous sculptor called Rydon. Apparently, there is a large section of the floor in there that tips like some sort of giant see-saw!
I'd certainly love to see a photograph of such an incredible feat of engineering!

I hear there's a giant archway of ice over the entrance to a town called Orkutsk. It sounds absolutely stunning.
Could you snap a shot of it for me?
I'm shivering with anticipation already!

The town of Orkutsk is apparently laid out in a ring shape, rather like a doughnut. At its centre, I hear, is the mayor's house.
Do you think you could get me a photograph of that?

In the snowy region known as Blizzard Peaks,
I hear there are caves full of overhead icicles.
In one such cave, they say there is even a
bridge made of ice! But it is as perilous as it is wondrous, it seems. Many have slipped off this extraordinary natural phenomenon, I hear.
But could you take a photograph of it for me?

Along with Neos and Maella, Savella Cathedral is one of the most important places in the world for believers. In travel guides, it's listed as the number one attraction in Argonia, I believe!
Would you be so kind as to take me a photograph of the magnificent interior of the great cathedral?

I've heard an unusual tale of a whole continent somewhere, cut off from the rest of the world. And at its centre, they say there are some huge stones arranged rather like a perch of some sort.
I can't say for sure if the place exists, of course, but if it happens to be true, you will snap a shot of it for me, won't you?

The tales I've heard about a whole continent somewhere, cut off from the rest of the world, include stories of a settlement even.
I really have no idea if the place exists or not, but if it does, could you photograph the place where the leader of the settlement lives?

I hear there's some sort of glass tunnel that links Savella Cathedral to the Lord High Priest's residence, through which an unusual lift carries passengers up and down. At either end of the tunnel are stone landing platforms, it seems.
Could you take me a photograph of this most curious arrangement, do you think?

Only a select few are ever permitted entry to the floating isle on which the Lord High Priest lives, of course. So we mere mortals never get to see what the place looks like. They call it the seat of the Goddess, you know!
Could you snap me a shot of the great man's residence, do you think?

The ultimate destination of any pilgrimage, the Holy Isle of Neos is another of the world's great religious sites, like Savella.
Could you take a photograph of the place for me so I can see what all the fuss is about?

Somewhere in the world there is <endash> according to what I hear <endash> a castle belonging to a king who collects mini medals. The castle is said to be ornately decorated all over with mini medal designs.
Do you think you could snap me a shot of this marvellous-sounding monument to medals?

Apparently there's even a fountain with a mini medal theme inside the castle of the King of Medals.
Such a rare design feature deserves a photograph, I think. Could you do the honours?

Rumour has it that somewhere in the world is an ancient shrine for worshippers of a dark religion. Even today, an evil aura emanates from the place, and an eerie darkness enshrouds it, dispelling all would-be visitors.
Brrr, I certainly wouldn't want to go near the place, but a photograph would be lovely!

I've heard that there is a terrifying statue of
the Lord of Darkness inside the ancient shrine
for worshippers of darkness. I do find myself wondering what it looks like.
I realise it's a frightening prospect, but could you snap me a shot of the statue if you happen to see it ever?

Inside the ancient shrine for worshippers of darkness is said to be an enormous rock carving depicting the Lord of Darkness coming to attack. Obviously I don't approve of such heresy, but I do find myself wondering what it looks like.
Could you take a photograph of the <endash> Dare I say it? <endash> work of art for me?

Rumour has it that deep within the ancient shrine for worshippers of darkness there are two terrifying statues that emit rays of light. And what's more, by some devilish contrivance, they can even move!
Should you ever come across such statues in that evil place, do snap a shot of them for me, won't you?

Even today, the legend of Captain Crow and his undiscovered hoard is known all over the world. Yet no one has ever found the pirate's hideout.
If you happen to be the one to unearth the sea dog's secret shelter, you won't forget to photograph his room for me, will you?

It seems impossible to believe, but rumour has
it there is a whole other world devoid of colour,
where everything is just shades of grey!
There's even a village there, apparently.
I realise it would be a waste of colour film,
but obviously if such a place really exists,
I'm going to need a photograph of it!

There is a little-known rumour about a place deep in the forest somewhere in which humans and monsters live together in peace. Apparently, there is a huge rock carving on the cliff above this extraordinary settlement.
I have no idea what the carving is supposed to depict, but if it exists, could you snap me a shot?

There is a little-known rumour about a place deep in the forest somewhere in which humans and monsters live together in peace. It's said to have a unique culture, and even the church there apparently looks very different to those in other places.
I would love a shot of something so unusual!

Not far from the red-leaved tree on the outskirts of Farebury is a giant tree whose branches seem to touch the sky. And apparently, high in its canopy is a mysterious stone tablet. 
The trouble is, I can't see any way to reach it. But if you happen to manage it somehow,
do take a photograph, won't you?

Apparently, there is a mysterious stone altar high atop a mountain on the western continent. No one has ever reached it, but people claim to have spotted it from another nearby peak through a break in the clouds. They even say there was a terrifying dragon on the altar.
Such a mysterious monument deserves photographing, as I'm sure you'll agree.

Trolls are famous gluttons, but apparently they're real gourmets who excel at cookery. Some even have their own special kitchens!
Of course, no one taken by a troll ever comes back to tell the tale, so this could all be nonsense. But if not, you will photograph a troll kitchen for me, won't you?

According to legend, there's a race of people
who live above the clouds and worship dragons.
It's said that in their village, they've adorned their most important meeting place with a statue of a guardian dragon.
If you ever find yourself in this place of legend, please do photograph the guardian of the village.

Legend says that in the land above the clouds there is a pathway that leads to the heavens. At the end of the path, is the Dragons' Gate, which guards the entrance to the divine one's throne.
I would love to see what that gate looks like! Could you snap me a shot?

It seems golden slime statues are all the rage recently. People tell me you can see them on display in towns and villages all over the world.
Be sure to snap me a shot of any that you happen to notice, won't you?

Be sure to snap me a shot of any that you happen to notice, won't you?

Be sure to snap me a shot of any that you happen to notice, won't you?

It seems golden slime statues are all the rage recently. People tell me you can see them on display in towns and villages all over the world.
Be sure to snap me a shot of any that you happen to notice, won't you?

I hear Farebury is home to a particularly accurate fortune-teller. They say there's nothing the man can't find by looking in his crystal ball. My future wife, even!
I jest, of course, but could you take a photograph of the great man, do you think?

The land between Alexandria and Port Prospect is all owned by the great Albert family. And I hear Lady Rosalind Albert manages the estate's affairs single-handedly. What a marvellous woman she must be!
Could you snap me a shot of the canny lady of the manor?

They say King Pavan of Ascantha is the wisest and kindest ruler of the land there has ever been, despite his young years.
Could you photograph the young monarch who shoulders such great responsibility?

I hear King Pavan has a most loyal and gentle maidservant. Even the castle's most senior vassals acknowledge the young woman's amazing virtues. She's said to be the most beautiful maid in the land as well!
Could you snap me a shot of this dutiful domestic, do you think?

Apparently there's a dog in Ascantha that was named by the king himself! What an honour for one of our four-legged friends.
If you find this regal hound, could you take a photograph of it for me?

They say there's a fellow in that famous town full of scoundrels who knows everything about everything. Seeing as I, too, gather information from around the world in the form of photographs, he and I are, in a sense, rivals.
So I should like to know what the man looks like. Could you oblige?

I hear there's a fortune-teller in Pickham famous for getting things wrong. So no matter what terrible things she foretells in your future, you don't have to worry at all! In some ways, being able to put your clientele at ease like that makes her a rather remarkable act.
Could you take a photograph of her for me?

Rumour has it there is a lady who's such a great thief, even the scoundrels and rogues of Pickham look up to her. She's as stealthy as a stalking lion and able to steal whatever she likes. And when she's not out thieving, you can find her relaxing in her den, apparently.
Could you photograph her doing that for me?

Apparently something called the Monster Arena has become all the rage among the rich and famous recently. But it's a very exclusive club, and the owner himself is rarely seen.
If you ever happen to be granted entry, could you snap a shot of the quirky chap who runs the place?

Apparently the two Golding children in charge of Baccarat's casino these days bicker like crazy! But there's really nothing like family in this world, is there?
I wonder if you could manage to get the two of them in a shot together?

They say the president of the Great Sabrecat Trust is such a busy man that you almost never see him.
Could you snap a sneaky shot of the world's number one sabrecat specialist, do you think?

I hear the King of Argonia is renowned for his dignity, presence of mind and wisdom. His fame is such that it has even crossed the vast ocean between the western continent and here.
Try to take a photograph of this most regal of rulers.

They say there is a most <endash> How should I put this? <endash> ‘unusual’ prince in Argonia. One hears all sorts of rumours, and it's hard to ignore when he's destined to become such an important ruler one day.
They say a picture paints a thousand words, so would you mind snapping a shot of the fellow?

I hear that somewhere in the world there's a walking corpse who's obsessed with making money and bettering himself. He likes to wear expensive accessories and dresses in the most flamboyant outfits, apparently.
If it's true, I should certainly like to see a photograph of such a mesmerising monster.

Arcadia is apparently home to a great magician with a long family legacy. He's said to be an animal lover, with a kind and generous nature, able and willing to heal injured travellers at the drop of a hat.
Could you photograph this paragon of magical munificence?

Arcadia is said to be home to the greatest living sculptor in the world, a man by the name of Rydon. But he's rather an eccentric, apparently. When he's working, he shuts himself away from the world and won't see anyone.
See if you can snap me a shot of this extraordinary artist, would you?

Records suggest there is a little-known race of elves in the world. They're said to be far more beautiful than we humans, and live much longer, too. But they are few in number, and live in secluded locations, so the chance of meeting one is very slim.
So if you ever come across one, snap it!

Apparently, in days gone by, our world was looked after by a great bird called the Godbird, who was always accompanied by two maidens that served her. Of course, this was so long ago, they must surely be dead by now.
But if they happened to still exist, I should be delighted if you could photograph them for me. Even a shot of a drawing would do!

I've heard tales about a priest somewhere in the world with the smallest body, the longest fangs and the foulest mouth of all! And despite his profanity, people say he's very well liked! It beats me, it really does!
I should certainly like to see a photograph of this peculiar priest if you ever encounter him.

Legend has it that there are people living above the clouds. I'm sure it must be nothing more than hearsay, but if such a people were to exist, I should like to know what their leader looked like.
That's what I'd like you to take a photograph of, if there's any truth to any of this, of course.

People say that every now and then when they're out walking around, they notice some[-]thing twinkling nearby. I really don't know what it's all about, but the phenomenon has been reported in various places around the world, apparently.
Anyway, you know what to do!

Fantastic! You found the phantasmal faerie!
And you didn't forget to photograph her!
You really are a camera whizz now, no question!

Why don't you try taking a photograph of me? Press the START button to look through the lens, then you simply press A to shoot.
Make sure you get my whole head in, won't you?
